Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enterocin 1071 (natural AMPs; Ent1071A, two-chain class 2b bacteriocin, UCLL2a; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; chain B is Enterocin 1071B or Ent1071B, see info; BBrcp))

Literature Information.Literature: This is a two-chain bacteriocin. The sequence of chain B is GPGKWLPWLQPAYDFVTGLAKGIGKEGNKNKWKNV.  Like Lactococcin G, this class 2b bacteriocin uses UppP as the receptor (Kjos M et al., 2014).Activity: Active against C. tyrobutyricum RC1, E. faecalis strains LMG 13566 and RC2 111,  E. faecium RC3, L. salivarius subsp. salivarius NCIMB 702747T,  L. innocua LMG 13568, Micrococcus sp., P. aerogenes MKB 12, P. freudenreichii subsp. shermanii, S. agalactiae ATCC 13813, but not active against B. cereus LMG 13569, B. gallicum LMG 11596, C. sporogenes LMG 13570, C. tyrobutyricum LMG 13571, E. faecalis BFE 1071, E. coli XL1-Blue MRF9 Stratagene, L. acidophilus LMG 13550,  L. casei LMG 13552, L. curvatus LMG 13553, L. fermentum LMG 13554, L. helveticus LMG 13555, L. plantarum LMG 13556, L. reuteri LMG 13557, L. sake LMG 13558, L. lactis subsp. lactis IL 1403, L. carnosum NCIMB 702776T, L. cremoris LMG 13562 and LMG 13563, L. mesenteroides subsp. cremoris NCIMB 4543, L. mesenteroides subsp. mesenteroides NCIMB 4518, P. mesenteroides subsp. mesenteroides NCIMB 4518, P. acidipropionici LMG 13572, Propionibacterium spp. LMG 13573, LMG 13574,  S. aureus MKB 38, S. carnosus LMG 13567, S. mutans MKB THSM, S. thermophilus LMG 13564, LMG 13565. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Balla E, Dicks LM, Du Toit M, Van Der Merwe MJ, Holzapfel WH.  WH2000
Literature Information.Title: Characterization and cloning of the genes encoding enterocin 1071A and enterocin 1071B, two antimicrobial peptides produced by Enterococcus faecalis BFE 1071.
